alert.note: Alert for Northern Westchester; Orange; Putnam; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 2:40PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Westchester, southeastern Orange, western Putnam and Rockland Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 240 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Peekskill, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New City, Ossining, Peekskill, Haverstraw, Mahopac, West Point, Cold Spring, New Windsor, Pomona, Harriman, Upper Nyack, Yorktown Heights, Fahnestock State Park, Stony Point and Jefferson Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
